page.title: 19SOCIAL CONCERNS IN N.FAREHAM
page.content: As a result of our interviews with local people certain social concerns came to light.The farmers were concerned about the way decisions made in the European parliament affected their lives and income.The E.E.C. milk quotas,which caused them to reduce the size of their dairy herds,was a recent example of this.Some local dwellers were concerned about rumours that Knowle Hospital was to be closed and mental patients were to be placed in houses amidst the local community.Two other often expressed concerns were the noise and danger from youngsters on motorbikes in the copses,and also dogowners who allowed their dogs to foul footpaths were a cause for concern.
